title: Which Major U.S. City Has The Most Extreme Sunshine And Rainfall Patterns?
description: Analyzing weather data from six major U.S. cities, this project examines seasonal extremes in sunshine and rainfall. Miami experiences the highest rainfall surges, while Chicago shows the greatest sunshine variability. Visualizations highlight how extreme differs by metric.

title: How Does The Average Mouse Temperature Change Over The Course Of The Entire Experiment?
description: Both figures analyze how average mouse temperature changes over a 14-day experiment. Figure 1 presents the full range (36°C–38.5°C), showing natural fluctuations. Figure 2 narrows the y-axis (36.2°C–36.7°C), exaggerating shifts. This highlights how axis scaling impacts data interpretation.

title: Interactive Mouse Temperatures Over 14 Days
description: The Nambu-kai Interactive Mouse Heatmap visualizes 14-day temperature data for multiple mice. Each row is a mouse, each column is a time bin (every 20 min), and colors represent avg. temp. Features include zooming, toggling mice, and tooltips. Built with D3 using an orange heat scale.
